author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BERYL PRODUCING FLASH FLOODING AND TORNADOES OVER EASTERN  TEXAS AND WESTERN LOUISIANA... ...DEADLY HAZARDS REMAIN AFTER THE STORM INCLUDING DOWNED POWER  LINES AND CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING FROM IMPROPER GENERATOR USE...
summary:
...BERYL PRODUCING FLASH FLOODING AND TORNADOES OVER EASTERN  TEXAS AND WESTERN LOUISIANA... ...DEADLY HAZARDS REMAIN AFTER THE STORM INCLUDING DOWNED POWER  LINES AND CARBON MONOXIDE POISONING FROM IMPROPER GENERATOR USE...
 As of 4:00 PM CDT Mon Jul 8
 the center of Beryl was located near 31.3, -95.1
 with movement NNE at 16 mph.
 The minimum central pressure was 993 mb
 with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary - Tropical Storm Beryl (AT2/AL022024)
